oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MODELING MORPHOLOGICAL EVOLUTION IN THE VICINITY OF COASTAL STRUCTURES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nam, Pham Thanh
Larson, Magnus
Hanson, Hans
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: morphodynamics
random waves
wave-induced currents
sediment transport
breakwater
T-head groin
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A numerical model of beach topography evolution was developed. The model includes five sub-models: random wave transformation model, surface roller model, wave-induced current model, sediment transport model, and morphological change model. The model was validated by two unique high-quality data sets obtained from experiments on the morphological impact of a detached breakwater and a T-head groin in the basin of the Large-scale Sediment Transport Facility (LSTF) at the US Army Corps of Engineer Research and Development Center in Vicksburg, Miss. The simulations demonstrated that the model well reproduced the wave conditions, wave-induced currents, and morphological evolution in the vicinity of the structures.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 32 (2010): Proceedings of 32nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Shanghai, China, 2010.; sediment.68
